'''Fallen trees''' are [[feature]]s that resemble a [[tree]] lying on the ground after falling over.

== Generation ==
Fallen trees consist of a single upright [[log]], making the stump, and a log (composed of a row of log blocks) lying on its side, making the trunk. The trunk is often found 1–2 blocks from the stump. 

The stump often has [[vines]] growing on its sides. 1–2 red or brown [[mushroom]]s can sometimes be found growing on the trunk.

Only [[oak]], [[spruce]], [[birch]], tall birch, and [[jungle tree]]s can generate as fallen trees.

Fallen trees can be found in all biomes where their standing tree variants grow, except the following:
* [[Meadow]]
* [[Bamboo Jungle]]
* [[River]]
* [[Grove]]
* [[Flower Forest]]
** Has fallen birch trees but not fallen oak trees.

=== Config ===
{{main|Configured feature}}
{{el|java}}
<section begin="config"/><div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|config}}
** {{nbt|compound|trunk_provider}} The block to use for the trunk.
*** {{Nbt inherit/block state provider}}
** {{Nbt|int}}{{Nbt|compound|log_length}} The length of the fallen log. Value between 0 and 16 (inclusive).
*** {{Nbt inherit/int provider}}
**{{nbt|list|log_decorators}} (Required, but can be empty) Decorations to add to fallen log of the tree 
***{{nbt|compound}} A decorator, see {{slink|Tree definition|Decorator}}
**{{nbt|list|stump_decorators}} (Required, but can be empty) Decorations to add to the stump.
***{{nbt|compound}} A decorator, see {{slink|Tree definition|Decorator}}
</div><section end="config"/>
